metadata.Title: CVE-2017-13695 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - negligible
metadata.Description:
The acpi_ns_evaluate() function in drivers/acpi/acpica/nseval.c in theLinux kernel through 4.12.9 does not flush the operand cache and causes akernel stack dump, which allows local users to obtain sensitive informationfrom kernel memory and bypass the KASLR protection mechanism (in the kernelthrough 4.9) via a crafted ACPI table.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-13695` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-164-generic - 4.4.0-130.156~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-130.156~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-lowlatency - 4.4.0-130.156~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-130.156~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-130.156~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-130.156~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-130.156~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-164-generic - 4.4.0-130.156~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-164-lowlatency - 4.4.0-130.156~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1054-aws - 4.4.0-1024.25
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1059-azure - 4.15.0-1023.24~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'was needed ESM criteria').
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-grouper: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').

linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-lts-utopic: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-lts-vivid: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-lts-wily: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-130.156~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1024.25').
linux-azure package in trusty/esm, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1023.24~14.04.1').
